PageTitle: display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface advertised-routes(Attribute Filter)
FuncDef: The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface advertised-routes command displays routes of BGP unnumbered peers. The display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface advertised-routes command displays routes of BGP unnumbered peers.
CLIs: display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface { <interface-name> | <IfType> <IFNum> } advertised-routes <ipv4-address> [ <mask> | <mask-length> ] { as-path | community-list | large-community | ext-community | cluster-list | advertised-peer }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an interface name.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.

Specifies an interface number.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.

Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask of an IP address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies the mask length.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 32.

Displays the community attribute contained in a route.
-

Displays the routes with the specified BGP Large-Community in the routing table.
-

Displays the cluster list of a route.
-

Displays the list of the peers to which a route is advertised.
-

Examples: <HUAWEI> display bgp routing-table unnumbered peer interface 100GE 1/0/1 advertised-routes 10.1.1.1 advertised-peer
ExtraInfo: You can specify different parameters for BGP unnumbered peers to view specific routing information.
